answers.answer: If you are a first time mom, most dont feel movement til at least 20 Weeks. The fact that you are out of your first trimester decreases your chance of miscarriage drastically. Let her know that stress will make u miscarry and she is creating that for you! You also prob wont show until around 20 Weeks either. Relax and educate yourself on pregnancy so you know what to look for and what to worry about, if none of that is happening then just enjoy YOUR pregnancy :)
iv been saying that! just wen you have this in your ear all day all night it frusterates me!!
and especially this genteic testing thing!! shes so worried....
Opt out of it and tell her that you will love your baby regardless...thats what Hubby and I did
Im a ftm and didn't feel movement til 17 weeks...i had no symptoms at all and didn't start showing til 24 weeksBut I also opted out of the genetic testing

Sweet girl, I am barely showing and I will be 29 weeks on Monday.  I didn't feel flutters until 18 weeks, and didn't feel full out kicks until 20 weeks.  The glucose test is a breeze and I passed my first hour one with flying colors, and even if you fail your first hour one that doesn't mean you will fail your 3 hour one.  Even if you do have gestational diabetes all that means is you have to watch what you eat and you might have a larger baby, but gestational diabetes goes away for both you and baby after baby is born.  The genetic test you can turn down, my doctor even told me she doesn't recommend people to get it unless they really really want it because it gives a lot of false positives.  Just because something on the genetic test comes back abnormal does NOT mean there is something wrong with your baby.  Also, you are passed the point where most people have miscarriages.  Most people have them before 12 weeks.  Since you have heard the heartbeat and you are passed 12 weeks you only have I think a 3% chance of miscarriage.  If this is your first baby you will feel kicks and start showing later then a women that already had a baby or 2 so please please don't worry.  Unless the doctor seems worried then you really have no need to worry.  I had a miscarriage last year so just imagine how crazy scared I was when I conceived this baby!  Just enjoy your pregnancy!!
my mom is kinda the same, but just saying that I need to eat more because I'm not giving my baby enough nutrients because of my morning sickness. just ignore her.

I didn't have morning sickness at all! I didn't even know I was pregnant until I was 17 weeks. I didn't show until late 5 months early 6 months. I didn't feel flutters until mid 6 months. I'm 30+5 my daughters kicks are a lot stronger compared to the flutters but my belly is small for how far I am but my dr said my.baby is fine so dont worry.don't stress! That's.not healthy for the baby. Just enjoy.your pregnancy.don't let anybody ruin.it in any way this is something that you should enjoy and always remember in a positive way (:
thank you everyone did any of you guys take this gentic testing?

I did. (Just the blood test one, not the amnio.) I figured it would either give me the peace of mind, or give me time to prepare and read up on the problem before the baby was born.  They don't tell you "yes" or "no" just what your odds are (like 1 in a couple hundred or so-or maybe less). But don't stress too much, I have a GF that was told her odds were 1 in 12 and she had a perfect baby. You can always tell your mom that you are not going to take the test just so she doesn't pester you about it.
i already took all the tests...i did the last one on wedesday so i guess its just waiting time i do want the peace of mind....what were u results?

usually they call you if your odds are extremely high. They told me about 20 minutes after the specialist reviewed my ultrasound that my odds were like 1 in 20,000 but they did blood and said they would call me within 72 hours if anything came up. Don't stress, I'm sure you're fine :)
PLUS, you really aren't at risk for anything unless you have a family history of it.  You aren't at risk (unless family history) of down-syndrome until 35 I think.  You will be okay.
its not the downs im worried about its like spine bifia and **** like that

question: my mother is making this pregnacy the worst for me!!!! im 15 weeks 4 days and shes like u should feel flutters and kicks by now shes stressing me out about this genetuc testing worrying me sick!! wants me to get heartbeat checked every weekd i duno wut to dooo she thiinks im going to miscarriage im not showing yet and have no sympotms and shes driving me nuts and now has me worrrried:(
title: STRESSED!
